column1: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
column2: "Even bad code can function. But if code isn’t clean
column3: it can bring a development organization to its knees. Every year
column4: countless hours and significant resources are lost because of poorly written code. But it doesn’t have to be that way."

column1: Clean Architecture: A Craftsman's Guide to Software Structure and Design
column2: "By applying universal rules of software architecture
column3: you can dramatically improve developer productivity throughout the life of any software system. Now
column4: building upon the success of his best-selling books Clean Code and The Clean Coder
column5: legendary software craftsman Robert C. Martin (“Uncle Bob”) reveals those rules and helps you apply them."
